bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 9, 1897

div1.p: Lazear writes about settling into a new house, in Baltimore. He also reports that Martha Houston is disappointed that Sweitzer will not be visiting her.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 9, 1897
div1.p:
Your letter
came day before yesterday
but we have been so
busy getting settled,
I have delayed
answering until now

We came in from
Windsor on Monday
and immediately a
hot wave made it
appearance. However
we have done very
well. We advertised
for a girl and got
one who seems very
promising. She went
on duty this morning.
Day before yesterday
we had a girl for
the day and yesterday
afternoon and evening
and night we were
at Windsor.

Mabel heard from her mother
yesterday. She seems very much
disappointed that you are not
going to Beverly and rather
blames Mabel for saying it
would be cold. You know
when Mabel said that she
had no idea you were
going to Beverly.

After all, we did not have
any very good reason for
saying it would be cold
and very likely it would be
very pleasant for you there
especially as they have all
moved to Mrs. Williams', the
place I recommended to you.
Perhaps you may want to
change your mind
about going if the
warm weather con-
tinues.

When I said your
room would be
ready for you I
meant that I hoped
you would come
right here. We can
fix things so everyone
will be comfortable
so you must not
hesitate on that
account. However
if you intend to visit
Aunt Kate perhaps
it would be more
pleasant for you
to go there first.
The country is very
beautiful this year
and you would
most likely enjoy
a visit there in
October more than
later on.

We enjoyed our visit at Windsor
very much indeed but it seems
very nice to be at home
again even in a hot wave
